name: Bondcliff

trails_config.name: Bondcliff Trail
trails_config.description: Features the most famous cliff-edge photo opportunity in the East. A long, rewarding journey through the heart of the Pemi Wilderness.
trails_config.parking_info: Lincoln Woods Trailhead, Kancamagus Hwy (NH-112), Lincoln, NH

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Bondcliff. At 4265 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4265 feet, Bondcliff is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Bondcliff Trail**, a **18.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **West Bond**, which is just 1.0 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
